@Anacondaz

You're welcome.


NOTE: there's a small error in the install notes, so here are the correct steps: 

Install KIS or KAV 2012 v12.0.0.374, or PURE v9.1.0.124, and activate as trial. 
1. Once a new license is required disable the Kaspersky Self-Defense.
2. Exit Kaspersky by using the Kaspersky system tray icon.
3. Start KTR2012-v1.1c and press the "Reset" button.
4. Wait for Kaspersky to launch and activate your new trial period.

Done!

>> Note: Your computer has to reboot when resetting Kaspersky 2012.

The reason I think people tend to prefer using keys, instead of trial resets, is the constant, non-stop nagging you have to endure during a trial period. If there was a way to stop the popups on my screen virtually every few minutes, i would probably use the resets, but unless that happens, then having to hunt for a new license once in awhile seems more convenient for me

If that is the case with this reset, then i WILL use it. I left the comment in the hope that someone could confirm one way or the other. My experience is that kaspersky is the worst for the nagging during a trial. I tend to use every area of my desktop and having to constantly close their windows to get to my shortcuts is more than an annoyance. i wish all companies offering trials would understand that. No offense intended to you RH
